Eduardo Jardim Simoes

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/8768860514819771
  • Última atualização do currículo em 20/08/2012

Eduardo Jardim Simões Médico, epidemiologista, professor, pesquisador, administrador, casado ha 29 anos. Acumula 29 anos de experiência na área de ensino acadêmico e pratica em medicina clinica, medicina preventiva, e saúde publica, com ênfase em epidemiologia, formacao de politica de saude, planejamento e avaliacao de servicos de saude e programs de saude publica. Dr. Simoes praticou medicina clinica geral por 8 anos e pratica saude publica por mais de 25 anos. Possui graduação em Medicina pela Universidade de Pernambuco (1981), mestrado em Saude Comunitaria pela University of London (1987), diploma de Medicina Tropical e mestrado em Saude Publica da London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, e mestrado em Epidemiologia pela Emory University (2001). Trabalhou para Secretaria de Saude de Recife, Emprea de Urbanizacao da Cidade de Recife, Secretaria de Educacao de Pernambuco, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention-Division of Nutrition, Emory University School of Medicine-Department of Preventive Medicine, Saint Louis University School of Public Health e University of Missouri School of Medicine. Foi Epidemiologist Chefe do Missouri Department of Health (1995-2003) e Diretor do Prevention Research Centers Program (PRC), da Division of Adult and Community Health do Centers for Disease Control and Prevention do United States Department of Health and Human Services (2003-2011). O Prevention Research Centers e um programa de mais de $60 Milhoes de US dollars por ano em ciclos competitivos a cada 5 anos para financiar e administrar pesquizas aplicadas em saude publica em 37 universidades Americanas involvendo aproximadamente 100 comunidades e 45 milhoes de pessoas. Desde Setembro de 2012 e o "Chairman" e "Distinguished Professor" do Department of Health Management and Informatics, School of Medicine, University of Missouri. Dr. Simoes foi Associate Professor por 8 anos e tem sido Adjunct Professor por 6 anos da Saint Louis University Schools of Public Health and Medicine. Tambem tem sido Adjunct Professor da University of Missouri School of Medicine nos ultimos 15 anos. Publicou mais de 70 artigos cientificos em jornais de medicina e saude publica com processo de "peer review", dois capitulos de livros e mais de 50 relatorios de saude publica publicados em orgaos governamentais de saude publica nos Estados Unidos. Oferecu mais de 20 oficinas e treinamentos como professor e ou palestrante principal convidado em conferencias/congressos e oficinas internacionais em medicina e saude publica. Apresentou mais de 70 trabalho cientifico em congressos e conferencias internacionais de medicina e saude publica. Tem feito mais de 20 consultorias em medicina e saude publica para organizacoes diversas tais como o Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Banco Mundial, Secretaria de Saude do Estado de Sao Paulo, Universidade Federal de Sao Paulo, IMIP-Recife, e Osteopathic School of Medicine- Kirkskvile-Missouri. (Texto informado pelo autor)

University of Missouri School of Medicine, UMSM, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

2011 - Atual
Vínculo: Professor Titular, Enquadramento Funcional: Chairman and Distinguished Professor, Carga horária: 40
Outras informações
Lideranca e Gerenciamento do Departament of Health Management and Informatic ; Ensino do curso Managerial Epidemiology no Mestrado de Administracao em Saude; e Aulas como Professor Convidado nos cursos de Epidemiology Course of the Masters of Science in Public Health program

Vínculo institucional

1997 - 2011
Vínculo: Part-time Faculty, Enquadramento Funcional: Adjunct Assistant Professor, Carga horária: 10
Outras informações
Work includes research and grant application, supervision (preceptor) and teaching of medical students, fellows and residents in public health and preventive medicine research. Achievements include presentation of six seminars on chronic disease related topics to medical fellows in the family and community medicine program, one formal lecture on Methodology of Complex Sampling Survey, collaboration in developing one grant proposal for development of the Centers for Family Medicine Research and Development (fully funded). Teaching of two annual courses in epidemiology applications in the management of health care, introductory level for a total of 10 courses required for graduation in the masters degree in health management and informatics.


Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, PRC, CDC/PRC, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

2003 - 2011
Vínculo: Distinguished Consultant,FTE, Enquadramento Funcional: Director of Prevention Research Centers Progr, Carga horária: 40
Outras informações
Lideranca e Gerenciamento do Prevention Research Centers Program Office (Program de Pesquisa Aplicada em Saude Publica do Governo federal dos Estados Unidos)


Saint louis University School of Public Health, SLUSPH, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

1996 - Atual
Vínculo: Visiting Professor, Enquadramento Funcional: Adjunct Professor

Vínculo institucional

1995 - 1996
Vínculo: Faculty, Enquadramento Funcional: Assistant Professor, Carga horária: 40
Outras informações
Work included teaching one Epidemiology Methods and an Introductory Epidemiology course for Masters and Doctoral level programs every year and research and grant application in chronic disease prevention and health promotion. Also, as a chronic disease epidemiologist assigned to the state of Missouri by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the work included assisting the state department of health to enhance and develop their chronic disease programs and surveillance system. In addition, it included the design and implementation of epidemiological studies. Achievements included: creation of a four-year surveillance plan, including a strategy for communication and disesemination of epidemiological and surveillance information and re-organization of the surveillance sector. Also, it included the collaborative writing of 3 surveillance enhancement grant applications that were fully funded. In addition, it included the statistical analyses and collaborative writing of 4 epidemiologic manuscripts.


Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, CDC, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

1991 - 1993
Vínculo: Civil Servant, Enquadramento Funcional: Visiting Associate, Carga horária: 20
Outras informações
Work included the analyses and report of epidemiologic data. Achievements included: statistical analyses of 4 epidemiologic studies and collaborative writing of 4 epidemiologic manuscripts on the associations between behavioral risk factors and diet.


Missouri Department of Health, MDH, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

1996 - 2003
Vínculo: Civil Servant, Enquadramento Funcional: Chief, Office of Epidemiology,State Epidemiol, Carga horária: 40
Outras informações
Lideranca e Gerenciamento dos projetos de epidemiologia para prevencao de doenacs cronicas do Departamento de Saude de Missouri; Lideranca e Gerenciamento do "Office of Epidemiology"do Departamento de Saude de Missouri e das investigacoes epidemiologicas a nivel estadual e nacional (involvendo o estado) e desenvolvimento de sistemas de vigilancia epidemiologica e em saude. Efetuou: Tres investigacoes de Clusters de Cancer 20 investigacoes de surto de doencas infecciosas Tres investigacoes de Clusters de doencas degenerativas a e nao-infecciosas Duas investigacoes de bioterrorismo de escopo nacional Elaboracao e implementacao de dezenas de relatorios epidemiologicos para o estado e regioes especificas


Emory University School of Medicine, EUSM, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

1993 - 1995
Vínculo: Employee, Enquadramento Funcional: Assistant Researcher, Carga horária: 20
Outras informações
Work included collection and analyses of epidemiologic data. Achievements included: data collection, statistical analyses, and writing of 2 manuscripts on epidemiologic studies on the relationship between ischemic heart disease and the abdominal diameter index (see work presented and publications).


Prefeitura Municipal de Recife, P/RECIFE, Brasil.
Vínculo institucional

1982 - 1989
Vínculo: Civll Servant, Enquadramento Funcional: Physician, Carga horária: 40
Outras informações
Begun as General Practitioner in Medicine in joint appointment between URB and Secretariat of Health of Municipality of Recife. In April 1984 became a part-time Medical Oficer and part-time Assistant Health Planner to Secretary of Health (Dr. Miguel D'Oherty). In April of 987 became full time Assistant Planner. As a medical Officer work included the management of primary health care centers and medical assistance. Achievements included: directing two primary health care units, with supervision of four medical doctors, two dentists, two lab technicians, six assistant nurses, and four clerical and janitorial workers in each of the centers. It also consisted of the formation of a health care delivery supervision team, training of middle level managers, and the design, implementation and reporting of one outbreak investigation. As an Assistant Planner work included planning and evaluation of primary health care programs; design, submission and implementation of specific primary health care projects; and development and implementation of information systems. Achievement included:the development and implementation of an evaluation strategy for the primary health care program; design, grant submission and funding (UNICEF) of one primary health care project ("Community Participation in Primary Health Care Planning"); and the design, piloting and implementation of the computerized information system for the public health services of Recife, Pernambuco State. The system covered approximately 800,000 people out of the 2,000,000 inhabitants, and 50 primary health care facilities with both surveillance and service output information. Between January and June of 1989, still as an employee of City of Recife was asked to assume an appointed position of Health Planner for the City of Jaboatao that provided leadership and support to the Secretary of Health of Jaboarao. Achievements in this position icluded the development of overall pluri-annual plan and strategies for the co


Governo do Estado de Pernambuco, GOVERNO/PE, Brasil.
Vínculo institucional

1984 - 1988
Vínculo: Civil Servant, Enquadramento Funcional: Coordinator of Research in Sports & Medicine, Carga horária: 20
Outras informações
Work included evaluating health activities and assisting research activities within the educational sector. Responsibilities consisted of evaluating the status of the medical exams in the elementary school systems of the state. It also included the design and implementation of the physical activity research unit in the physical education center associated with the School of Physical Education, Federal University of Pernambuco. Achievements included: designed, staffed and implemented activities of the Physical Activities Research Unit of the Santos Dumont Physical Education Center; performed over 120 anthropometric measurements and physiologic evaluations (stress testing, ECG) on elementary and high-school students and athletes active in the center; produced a survey report on the level of satisfaction with and awareness of physical activities among participants of physical activities in health clubs and fitness centers of Recife, Brazil; wrote a leisure-time physical activity program for both the underserved and the touristic areas of the city of Recife; and wrote a proposal for reformulation of medical exams in the educational system of the state of Pernambuco, Brazil.


EJS Consultoria LTDA, EJS CONSULTORIA, Brasil.
Vínculo institucional

2010 - Atual
Vínculo: Proprietário, Enquadramento Funcional: Consultor principal



Projetos de pesquisa
2002 - 2004
Determining Baseline Prevalence for Provider Diagnosed Multiple Sclerosis and Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis in Herculaneum, Missouri
Descrição: Project aims were: 1) determining prevalence of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) and Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) in Herculaneum, Missouri; 2) establishing a disease registry (MS and ALS) in Missouri; 3) Assessing feasibility and usefulness of registry; 4) investigating associations of MS and ALS with environmental exposures in Herculaneum, Missouri.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
2001 - 2003
An Investigation of the Etiology of Anemia in WIC Children, 12-35 Months: Special Interest Project 17-01
Descrição: Used WIC clinic database and PRAM surveillance data to investigate trends, patterns and associations between diagnosed anemia and a range of risk and intervening factors..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Integrante / Ross C. Brownson - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
2001 - 2003
Evaluation of an Arthritis Self-Management Education Program:SIP 3-01
Descrição: Evaluation of the efficacy of a self-management strategy to reduce signs and symptoms of active disease and prevent complications of arthritis..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Integrante / Ross C. Brownson - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
2000 - 2002
Reinventing Surveillance Systems for Communicable Disease Prevention: Linking Morbidity, Risky Behaviors and Reproductive Health Outcomes:Supplement to H25-CCH704352
Descrição: Evaluated feasibility and usefulness of linkages of public health surveillance databases to investigate associations between risky behaviors and reproductive health outcomes..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
1996 - 1997
Prostate Cancer Early Detection: Prostate Screening Practices in Missouri (CA U28/CCU 709855-03)
Descrição: Study aimed to assess prostate cancer screening practices (patterns and trends over a two-year period), and identify explanatory factors and determinants of practices while establishing survey-based methodology to monitorscreening practices in Missouri..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Coordenador / Deborah A. Lawson - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
1995 - 2003
Vigilancia Epidemiológica e Investigações
Descrição: Três investigações de Clusters de Câncer; 20 investigações de surtos de doenças infecciosas; Duas investigações de bioterrorismo de escopo nacional; Elaboração e implementação de dezenas de relatórios epidemiológicos para o estado e regiões específicas; Planejamento e gerenciamento com aplicação de convênios para mais de 20 programas de saúde pública.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Coordenador.


Outros Projetos
1997 - 1999
Evaluation of the School Component of the Fruits and Vegetables Program in Missouri. Cooperative agreement Program Announcement 790
Descrição: Project aimed to evaluate implementaton and impact of the Five a Day Program on the levels of fruts and vegetables intake among the school-aged population of Missouri..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Outra.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.
1996 - 1998
Prevention Center Behavioral Risk Factors Surveillance System (BRFSS) Network
Descrição: Develop a network of Prevention Research Centers to demonstrate and assess the usefulness of the Behavioral Risk Factors Surveillance System for the purpose of applied public health research..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Outra.

Integrantes: Eduardo Jardim Simoes - Integrante / Ross C. Brownson - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention - Cooperação.

Prêmios e títulos
2011
Awarded the Global Health Achievement - Group "for superior accomplishment in supporting the Fiel Epidemiology Training Program and substantial public health impact in Brazil", Centers for Diesase Control and Prevention, Coordinating Office of Global Health.
2003
Awarded a nomination certificate for the 2003 "CDC-ATDSDR Charles C. Shepard Science Award" for published research: Clinical Bronchiolitis Obliterans in Workers at a Microwave-Popcorn Plant. In The Ne, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
2003
Awarded a certificate of appreciation for outstanding and dedicated services to the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services and the citizens of Missour, Missouri Department of Health.
2002
Awarded a Honorable Mention for the 2003 "CDC-NIOSH Alice Hamilton Award" for published research: Clinical Bronchiolitis Obliterans in Workers at a Microwave-Popcorn Plant. In The New England Journal, National Institute of Occupation and Safety Health.
1997
Awarded a nomination certificate for the 1997 "CDC-ATDSDR Charles C. Shepard Science Award" for published research: Epidemiology 1996; 7:161-65, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Outras informações relevantes

 
Dr. Simoes received his medical degree from Faculdade de Medicina, Universidade de Pernambuco in 1981, his Master of Science in Community Health and Diploma of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, University of London in 1987, and Master of Public Health from Emory School of Public Health, Emory University in 1991. 

In 1982, Dr. Simoes began his career in medicine and public health as a general practitioner. From 1984-1989, Dr. Simoes served as the District Medical Officer and Program Coordinator in the Secretariat of Health and the Coordinator for Research and Health Programs in the Secretariat of Education of the State of Pernambuco, Department of Physical Activities Sports in Recife, Brazil. From 1991-1993, Dr. Simoes was a Visiting Associate with the Division of Nutrition at CDC.  Dr. Simoes served as the Chief Chronic Disease Medical Epidemiologist for Missouri from 1996-2000 and as the Chief of the Office of Epidemiology and State Epidemiologist for the Missouri Department of Health from 2000-2003. In addition, he has been an Assistant Professor in Community Health in the School of Public Health, Saint Louis University (1995-Current), and an Adjunct Assistant Professor in the Department of Health Services Management in the School of Medicine, University of Missouri (1996- current). He is currently the Director of the Prevention Research Centers Program in the Division of Adult and Community Health (Since February 2003).

Dr. Simoes is recognized for developing public health programs and conducting intervention research. He has consulted and contributed to public health projects in collaboration with CDC and other national and international agencies. Dr. Simoes has designed and implemented more than 60 epidemiological studies with public health practice applications resulting in peer-reviewed publications in major public health and medical journals.
